text: Dutch police have discovered a family
who spent nearly a decade hidden away on
a remote farm apparently waiting for the
end of time a father and his five adult
children were found after his eldest son
turned up in a local town the children
were aged between 18 and 25 none of
their birds had been registered with
more details here's the BBC's Sylvia
Lennon's fence the flat endless
countryside of the Dutch province of
treinta a secluded farmhouse hidden away
behind trees and bushes no one was
really sure who lived here or what went
on inside these walls it was all a
mystery until a young man walked into a
local pub drank five beers and asked for
help here each provide a bleak heart
done I could immediately see he was
confused he had long hair and a dirty
beard and dirty old clothes it didn't
make sense when police arrived they
found his father and four siblings
living in a small space in the house
that could be locked and it wasn't known
if they were there voluntarily they'd
been there
apparently alone for years surviving on
homegrown vegetables and livestock it's
not clear if any of the children had
ever gone to school or even knew that
other people existed officers wouldn't
confirm speculation the family were
waiting for the end of time a dementia
in the morning what a deputies did part
of our investigation is to find out what
the people were doing there are still
many questions to which we have no
answer a man has been arrested although
it's not believed he's the father the
local mayor said the children's mother
died some time ago the family had been
taken to an undisclosed location and
according to police are being given all
care and attention perhaps in the coming
days and weeks the truth will be told of
their strange hidden life waiting for
the world to end
Sylvia Lenin Spence BBC news
